alert.note: Alert for Dauphin (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 04 at 9:50PM EST until February 05 at 2:34AM EST by NWS State College
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Pennsylvania... Swatara Creek Above Middletown affecting Dauphin County. For the Swatara Creek...including Middletown...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING THROUGH LATE TONIGHT... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Swatara Creek Above Middletown. * WHEN...Until just after midnight tonight. * IMPACTS...At 11.0 feet, Minor overbank flooding begins near the Vine Street Bridge downstream to the Susquehanna River. At 12.0 feet, Both banks overflow upstream of the Vine Street Bridge and several basements are affected. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:30 PM EST Friday the stage was 12.1 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 9:30 PM EST Friday was 12.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage late tonight and continue falling to 5.1 feet Monday evening. - Flood stage is 11.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 12.6 feet on 04/18/2011. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued late tonight.
